list.title: Database#["close"]
list.description:
Close the database, and all associated prepared statements. The memory associated to the database and all associated statements will be freed.

Warning: A statement belonging to a database that has been closed cannot be used anymore.

Databases must be closed when you're finished with them, or the memory consumption will grow forever

list.title: Database#["each"]
list.description: Execute a sql statement, and call a callback for each row of result. Currently, this method is synchronous, it will not return until the callback has been called on every row of the result. But this might change.

list.title: Database#["exec"]
list.description:
Execute an SQL query, and returns the result.

This is a wrapper against {@link Database.prepare}, {@link Statement.bind}, {@link Statement.step}, {@link Statement.get}, and {@link Statement.free}.

The result is an array of result elements. There are as many result elements as the number of statements in your sql string (statements are separated by a semicolon)

Example use

We will create the following table, named test and query it with a multi-line statement using params:

id age name
1 1 Ling
2 18 Paul

We query it like that:

var db = new SQL.Database();
var res = db.exec(
    "DROP TABLE IF EXISTS test;\n"
    + "CREATE TABLE test (id INTEGER, age INTEGER, name TEXT);"
    + "INSERT INTO test VALUES ($id1, :age1, @name1);"
    + "INSERT INTO test VALUES ($id2, :age2, @name2);"
    + "SELECT id FROM test;"
    + "SELECT age,name FROM test WHERE id=$id1",
    {
        "$id1": 1, ":age1": 1, "@name1": "Ling",
        "$id2": 2, ":age2": 18, "@name2": "Paul"
    }
);

res is now :

    [
        {"columns":["id"],"values":[[1],[2]]},
        {"columns":["age","name"],"values":[[1,"Ling"]]}
    ]

list.title: Database#["export"]
list.description: Exports the contents of the database to a binary array

list.title: Database#["getRowsModified"]
list.description: Returns the number of changed rows (modified, inserted or deleted) by the latest completed INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statement on the database. Executing any other type of SQL statement does not modify the value returned by this function.

list.title: Database#["handleError"]
list.description: Analyze a result code, return null if no error occurred, and throw an error with a descriptive message otherwise

list.title: Database#["iterateStatements"]
list.description: Iterate over multiple SQL statements in a SQL string. This function returns an iterator over {@link Statement} objects. You can use a for...of loop to execute the returned statements one by one.

list.title: Database#["run"]
list.description: Execute an SQL query, ignoring the rows it returns.

list.title: Energy#amount
list.description: the amount of energy in this unit

list.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, {@link Energy} consectetur adipiscing el

list.title: Environment#livingThings
list.description: All the living things in this environment

list.title: PhotoSize
list.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

list.title: Statement#["bind"]
list.description:
Bind values to the parameters, after having reset the statement. If values is null, do nothing and return true.

SQL statements can have parameters, named '?', '?NNN', ':VVV', '@VVV', '$VVV', where NNN is a number and VVV a string. This function binds these parameters to the given values.

Warning: ':', '@', and '$' are included in the parameters names

Value types

Javascript type SQLite type
number REAL, INTEGER
boolean INTEGER
string TEXT
Array, Uint8Array BLOB
null NULL

list.title: Statement#["free"]
list.description: Free the memory used by the statement

list.title: Statement#["freemem"]
list.description: Free the memory allocated during parameter binding

list.title: Statement#["get"]
list.description: Get one row of results of a statement. If the first parameter is not provided, step must have been called before.

list.title: Statement#["getAsObject"]
list.description: Get one row of result as a javascript object, associating column names with their value in the current row.

list.title: Statement#["getColumnNames"]
list.description: Get the list of column names of a row of result of a statement.

list.title: Statement#["getNormalizedSQL"]
list.description: Get the SQLite's normalized version of the SQL string used in preparing this statement. The meaning of "normalized" is not well-defined: see {@link https://sqlite.org/c3ref/expanded_sql.html the SQLite documentation}.

list.title: Statement#["getSQL"]
list.description: Get the SQL string used in preparing this statement.

list.title: Statement#["reset"]
list.description: Reset a statement, so that it's parameters can be bound to new values It also clears all previous bindings, freeing the memory used by bound parameters.

list.title: Statement#["run"]
list.description: Shorthand for bind + step + reset Bind the values, execute the statement, ignoring the rows it returns, and resets it

list.title: Statement#["step"]
list.description: Execute the statement, fetching the next line of result, that can be retrieved with {@link Statement.get}.

list.title: StatementIterator#["getRemainingSQL"]
list.description: Get any un-executed portions remaining of the original SQL string

list.title: World.defaultOptions
list.description: Return a default options object, origin at center.

list.description: This is an alias. It's original name is start9
